text.section: The State Fire Marshal shall issue a license or permit to each applicant who meets the requirements of this subtitle.

section.section: An applicant for a license to possess explosives for use in firearms need not have sufficient experience in handling explosives or work under satisfactory supervision in handling explosives.

An applicant for a license to possess explosives to be used for agricultural purposes need not:
have sufficient experience in handling explosives or work under satisfactory supervision in handling explosives; or
have suitable facilities for handling explosives.

text.section:
Before a license or permit may be issued under this subtitle to an employer to engage in an activity in which the employer may employ a covered employee, as defined in § 9-101 of the Labor and Employment Article, the employer shall file with the State Fire Marshal:
a certificate of compliance with the Maryland Workers' Compensation Act; or
the number of a workers' compensation insurance policy or binder.

On issuance of a license or permit under this section, the State Fire Marshal shall notify:
the fire chief or fire administrator in the county where the license or permit was issued; or
if the county does not have a county fire chief or fire administrator, the local 9-1-1 center.
